description.narrative: Overall objective: To accelerate the transitional justice process by accounting for missing persons from the conflict of 1992-1995 Specific objective: To increase domestic ownership of the missing persons process and to ensure continuity in resolving missing persons issues Result 1: Established policy dialogue with domestic authorities and families of the missing on sustainability of the missing persons process. Result 2: Scientifically verifiable methods applied during search and identification of missing persons.

Stöd till sökandet och identifieringen av försvunna människor från kriget 1992-95 i BiH.
Insatsen handlar om fortsatt stöd till International Commission for Missing Persons (ICMP). Det senaste avtalet mellan Sverige och ICMP slutade den 31 augusti 2019. ICMP har fått direkt stöd från Sverige sedan 2008 (förutom några månader utan medel / avtal). Det totala utbetalda beloppet sedan 2008 uppgår till 56 MSEK. Sverige går in med medel i projektet tillsammans med EU som genom IPA-stöd bidrar med 3 000 000 EUR. Sverige bidrar med 9 000 000 SEK.
ICMP är en mellanstatlig fördragsbaserad organisation som arbetar med regeringar, civilsamhällesorganisationer, rättsliga institutioner, internationella organisationer och andra över hela världen för att ta itu med frågan om människor som har försvunnit till följd av väpnad konflikt, kränkningar av de mänskliga rättigheterna, katastrofer, organiserade brottslighet, oregelbunden migration och andra orsaker. ICMP har arbetat i BiH sedan 1996 med sökning och identifiering av försvunna människor från kriget. Cirka 70% av de saknade personerna i landet har identifierats och nationella institutioners kapacitet har byggts till följd av ICMPs arbete.
Det övergripande målet för projektet är att påskynda övergångsrättvisa genom att hitta och identifiera saknade personer från konflikten 1992-1995. Det specifika målet är att öka det inhemska ägarskapet till processen för försvunna personer och säkerställa kontinuitet i hanteringen av saknade personer. ICMP kommer därför att arbeta med tekniskt bistånd till inhemska myndigheter i sökandet efter försvunna personer och med kapacitetsuppbyggnad av myndigheter och stöd till familjeorganisationer i syfte att överföra ägarskapet kring hanteringen av försvunna personer i Bosnien och Hercegovina.

Support to the search and identification of missing persons from the war in BiH 1992-95.
The contribution is about continued support to the International Commission for Missing Persons (ICMP). The last agreement between Sweden and ICMP ended August 31 2019. ICMP has received direct support from Sweden since 2008 (apart from a few months without funds/agreement). The total amount of disbursed funds since 2008 amounts to 56 MSEK. Sweden will contribute with funds for the project together with EU, who provides 3 000 000 EUR through IPA-funds. Sweden contributes with 9 000 000 SEK.
ICMP is an intergovernmental treaty-based organisation working with governments, civil society organizations, justice institutions, international organizations and others throughout the world to address the issue of people who have gone missing as a result of armed conflict, human rights abuses, disasters, organized crime, irregular migration and other causes. ICMP has worked in BiH since 1996 with the search and identification of missing persons from the war. Around 70 % of the missing persons in the country have been identified and capacities of national institutions have been built as a result of ICMPs work.
The overall objective of the project is to accelerate the transitional justice process by accounting for missing persons from the conflict of 1992-1995. The specific objective is to increase domestic ownership of the missing persons process and to ensure continuity in resolving missing persons issues. Hence, ICMP will work with technical assistance to domestic agencies in the search for missing persons and with capacity building of agencies and support to associations of families of the missing with the aim to transfer ownership of the issue of addressing missing persons in BiH.

sector.narrative: Civilian peace-building, conflict prevention and resolution

tag.narrative: 16.10 - 0 Säkerställa allmän tillgång till information och skydda grundläggande friheter, i enlighet med nationell lagstiftning och internationella avtal.

16.6 - Bygga upp effektiva och transparenta institutioner med ansvarsutkrävande på alla nivåer.
16.6 - Develop effective, accountable and transparent institutions at all levels.

description.narrative:
After one year of implementation, several positive results are visible. Although not included in the results framework, it is important to note that the overall number of active missing persons cases decreased by 3 percent, compared to the baseline. 239 cases were closed in the reporting period, thanks to ICMP's search and identification of missing persons. In relation to Result 2 (see above), ICMP has even exceeded some of the set targets fror the whole implementation period. ICMP will continue this part of the work nevertheless.
When it comes to Result 1, ICMP has indeed already established a policy dialogue, and is on a good track of transfering ownership of the process to domestic authorities. Through meetings with associations of families of the missing, these stakeholders have also understood this (quite senistive) issue and provided their consent/support to ICMP's proposal. Families stressed that it is time for BiH to take on a greater role in the process of identifying its missing persons, although some of them shared doubts about the state's capacity to do so. Therefore, they stressed that ICMP should provide its assistance to BiH and make provisions for quality control. Dialogue has also been held with the Agency for Forensic Examination and Expertise of BiH (AFEE). The ministry of security is also on board, including the minister. Concrete steps have been taken towards transfering of ownership of the process, as the the MoS has agreed on formalizing the cooperation with ICMP on strengthening the capacities of AFEE, where ICMP will assist the AFEE with technical expertice and capacity building with objective to build enough capacity for sustainablitity beyond ICMP involvement.
ICMP adjusted the original plans to new circumstances. The planned Whitepaper, that ICMP were about to develop for adoption at the Council of Ministers, were annuelled since the likelihood of CoM adoption was very small. Instead, ICMP developed a technical agreement to be directly signed through exchange of letters between ICMP and the MoS. This was agreed, a lot thanks to ICMP's policy dialogue with the MoS about the missing persons issue.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
